quest.name: A Test of Technique
journal: Guildmaster Geva wishes to evaluate your progress.
In order to evaluate your progress, Geva instructs you to prepare three leather chokers. Craft the items as requested and present them to her.

Geva declares your workmanship satisfactory─for a jobbing leatherworker. She rewards you with an amateur's awl and reminds you to work hard if you wish to rise from obscurity and become a famous craftswomancraftsman.

※The next leatherworker quest will be available from Geva upon reaching level 10.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Getting used to that knife I gave you? Gods know it doesn't happen very often, but you've chanced to find me unoccupied. How about you show me what you've learned?

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Let's see you make three leather chokers.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: After all, there's more to our craft than simply tanning hides, and chokers are just about the simplest things one can make.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: You'll need circles of leather and animal sinew to accomplish this task. Osgyth can provide the sinew, and I'm sure you recall the method for making leather.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I hope your technique has improved since last time.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Now, while we have an ample stock of skins, there are other means of procuring your materials.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Hunting for your own pelts, for instance. Aye, I know what I said about that before. But that was about assuming it was necessary. Choosing to do so is another matter. Indeed, it may teach you to appreciate the source of your livelihood.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Not all leatherworkers are wont to choose this method...but you are an adventurer, are you not?

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: When you've finished your work, bring your chokers here for inspection.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: You've finished your work, then?

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I suppose there is no denying that these are leather chokers.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: If truth be told, an opo–opo could've achieved similar results given skins, sinew, and time.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Oh, but I don't mean to make light of your efforts. You fulfilled the order precisely as requested─a job well done.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Now then, I will teach you something to supplement your learning.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Through physical training, the body can be made strong and resistant to injury. Not so the throat, which ever remains a vulnerable point.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Although a leather choker provides less protection than a metal gorget, its simple design makes it ideal for everyday applications.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: This simplicity also makes it an ideal choice for beginners practicing basic techniques─and for guildmasters assessing their progress.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: As you are, you would make a passable leatherworker─one among the nameless multitudes who scrape a living out there. Whether you rise to become something more is contingent upon your efforts.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Consider this amateur's awl a reward for your efforts.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: You will find it an indispensable partner to the head knife as you continue your training.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Now, I must return to my work. If you chance to find me unoccupied again, mayhap I will teach you something else.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Till then, keep your nose to the grindstone!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Certain gear grants bonuses to your craftsmanship, control, and CP values.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A higher craftsmanship rating hastens the progress of synthesis; greater control increases the chance of creating high-quality items; and additional CP improves your crafting stamina.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Outfitting yourself with an eye to your current objective will increase the efficiency of your crafting endeavors.
